title: Arthur Smith Sends Blunt Message On Steelers Offense After Aaron Rodgers Signing Didnt Do It To Run The Wishbone.html
content: Steelers Schedule Best Sportsbooks Steelers Breakdown Podcast Pittsburgh Steelers **Arthur Smith sends blunt message on Steelers offense after Aaron Rodgers signing: ‘Didn’t do it to run the Wishbone’** Published:Jun. 11, 2025, 3:00 p.m. Pittsburgh Steelers offensive coordinator Arthur Smith, during 2025 Pittsburgh Steelers - OTAs Kylee Surike | Special to PennLiveKylee Surike Nick Farabaugh | nfarabaugh@pennlive.com PITTSBURGH --ThePittsburgh Steelersadded a ton of talent for offensive coordinator Arthur Smith, trading forDK Metcalfand now signing quarterbackAaron Rodgers. Yet, Smith admits the team this year, while wanting to run the ball more efficiently, will have a more natural focus on passing the football. In his words, they did not make these moves to go out there and run the Wishbone, which is a popular formation that includes a running quarterback and two running backs and a fullback. “You don’t bring Aaron (Rodgers) in here and sign DK (Metcalf) for all that money to go run the Wishbone.” Rodgers had 28 touchdowns to 11 interceptions in 2024. He went just 5-12 in his starts with the Jets, and even after they acquired Davante Adams, went just 3-8. It was a tough season for Rodgers, who also had multiple leg injuries. The Steelers think something remains in the tank for the former four-time MVP. They zeroed in on him as their target, as a result, especially after missing on re-signingJustin Fields. Now, Rodgers will be with the Steelers on a deal that will not break the bank, and could still land them another wide receiver to help Rodgers. Even at this stage of his career, with things on the downswing, Rodgers’ offenses still have a ton of spread personnel and will focus on passing the ball heavily.
